intro: Corybas hatchii, commonly known as the New Zealand ghost orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to New Zealand. It is a terrestrial orchid with a distinctive, hood-like flower that is typically dark purple or black in color. The plant produces a single, showy flower that is often hidden beneath its foliage, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Corybas hatchii is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
